entry.title: SAP BTP ABAP Environment – New software delivery option “Add-On Product”
entry.content:
Disclaimer: Information provided in this blog post serves as general overview only and does not replace legal agreements between SAP and its contractual parties. As this blog post is updated in an irregular fashion, it cannot serve as single point of truth. Please refer to your assigned SAP account/partner manager for most up-to-date information, especially regarding applicable licensing and pricing models.

 

Introduction

SAP BTP ABAP Environment (aka Steampunk) supports now two options for partners to deliver products to their customers.

Partners build side-by-side extensions and deliver them as multitenant software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions. This option is considered as a service offering. The partner is fully responsible for the development and production including the operations of the multitenant SaaS solution. The customers can adapt the mutlitenant SaaS solution to their business using key-user extensibility.

There are also use cases where customers want to operate the partner solution in their own environment or have the need for more comprehensive enhancement of the partner solution using developer extensibility in addition to key user extensibility to meet the customer business needs. The right way for partners to deliver such products is the newly available software delivery option, called “Add-On Product” (first announced as "Installable Product"). It allows partners to provide their solution to customers as a software offering ("Add-On Product") and not as a service. The partner solution offered as software is available for all the customers to whom it was sold by the partner. The customer installs and operates it in his own SAP BTP ABAP Environment systems. The market place for partner solutions delivered as an Add-On Product is the SAP Store. A prerequisite to benefit from the new software delivery option is a SAP PE Build contract for the respective partner. 

Overview about the two delivery options for commercial partners:

CharacteristicMultitenant SaaS SolutionAdd-On Product (New Option)
Offering typeService Software
Runs in BTP Global Account owned by PartnerCustomer
Operations responsibility PartnerCustomer
Schedule upgrades/patches responsibilityPartner Customer
Infrastructure costs taken by  PartnerCustomer
Extensibility optionKey-user extensibilityDeveloper extensibility
Commercial prerequisitesContract for productive useSAP PE Build contract with SAP Store enhancement
Product offering in SAP Store is mandatoryNoYes

A partner can offer the same product as a multitenant SaaS Solution and as an Add-On Product at the same time for different customers. With such a hybrid approach, a partner can fulfill both, requirements of smaller customers for a standardized service at minimum infrastructure costs and requirements of bigger customers regarding developer extensibility and running the product in the customer's infrastructure.

 

What is SAP PE Build?

SAP offers various partner programs and models. One of these is the SAP PartnerEdge program. The SAP PartnerEdge program has four different tracks, depending on the partner's focus. These tracks are Sell, Build, Service, and Run. To deliver the Add-On Product on the SAP BTP ABAP Environment, the partner requires the SAP PE track "Build". Using any other track is not possible. 

The SAP PartnerEdge Build program provides SAP partners access to resources, services, and benefits to successfully collaborate with SAP. SAP PartnerEdge – Build is a licensing and GTM model for partners that design, develop, and commercialize applications and software that extend the value of SAP applications. The model features standard terms and fixed revenue share pricing. Partners can publish solutions in the SAP Store, so that customers can consume the products through them. The provision of the Add-On product is only permitted and possible via the SAP Store.  

The PE Build Track provides several benefits for the partner. 

Onboarding support: Resources include development and test licenses, advisory and support services, installation and migration guides, and SAP Open Source offerings on GitHub. 

Enablement tools: Help is at hand with support and help portals, how-to guides, developer communities, the SAP Cloud Appliance Library tool, and SAP API Business Hub. 

Training resources: You can hone your skills using the openSAP platform, the SAP  Enterprise Architecture Explorer site, and SAP Learning Journey guides.

 

Requirements and Licensing

Partners must meet some requirements to participate in the PE Build Program. These requirements include the following:

  • Valid due diligence
  • Need to agree to the SAP PartnerEdge program agreements
  • Completion of compliance trainings
  • The Accounts payable is in good standing
  • Fulfillment of the compliant partnership requirements
  • Paying of the annual program fee
  • Maintenance of ongoing generic and track-specific program requirements
  • Prerequisites for publishing on SAP store.  

The respective prices for a partner vary because they depend on the BTP services used, the revenue share, and the annual fee. You can find more information about pricing, revenue share and annual contributions here. All information about the Terms & Conditions is available here

The following material numbers are required for an SAP BTP ABAP environment. 

License TypeMaterial numberMaterial nameMetricBlock sizeMin. blocks
PE Build8006181SAP BTP ABAP Environment, runtime GB Memory16 GB1
PE Build8006182SAP BTP ABAP Environment, persistence GB Memory16GB2

The minimum setup of a system is 16 GB runtime (ABAP runtime) and 32 GB persistence (HANA Cloud memory). This is why customers and partners have to buy at least 1 unit of 16 GB runtime and 2 units of 16 GB persistence in order to get started. 

Furthermore, the partner also needs authorization to make their own software available via the SAP Store. 

Any partner selling a GTM-ready solution must adhere to paying a revenue share to SAP according to the price list for the Build track of the SAP PartnerEdge program, regardless of whether SAP facilitated the customer transaction (for example, through an SAP sales representative) or not.

 

How does the partner provide the Add-On Product?

The approach for developing and building an Add-On Product is the same as for the multitenancy SaaS product. The partner development is done via the BTP Global Account and then the Landscape Portal is used to build the product based on the developed custom software component(s). 

From then on, the process differs from that of the multitenancy SaaS product. 

The partner registers the Add-On Product in the SAP Solution Hub and maintains all necessary data for provision in the SAP Store.  The partner is getting access to the SAP Solution Hub via the mandatory SAP PE Build contract. In the final step, the partner publishes the product in the Landscape Portal.

 

What does the customer need to do?

The customer needs to select the product from the SAP Store and needs to contact the partner via the respective form in the SAP Store. After selling the product by the partner to the customer, a signed Amendment to SAP Business Technology Platform Supplemental Terms and Conditions for ABAP Add-ons is required of the customer. This amendment is automatically part of the SAP Business Technology Platform Supplemental Terms and Conditions for new BTP contracts and renewed BTP contracts with signed date on April 23, 2025 or later. This is also true for all SAP Build contracts.

For customer BTP contracts signed before April 23, 2025, the customer (or the partner on behalf of the customer) need to create a customer ticket for component BC-CP-ABA. This customer ticket represents a service request for SAP to initiate a DocuSign process that the customer signs the required above-mentioned amendment. Please specify in the ticket:

  • Purpose: Sign amendment for ABAP Add-ons  
  • Customer name and ID (if the ticket was created by the partner on behalf of the customer)
  • Contact email address on customer side who will be the recipient for the DocuSign process

The amendment needs to be signed only once per customer and is independent of the vendor of the product to be installed. The customer can only see the product in the Landscape Portal if the amendment is signed. 

The customer is responsible to install the product and to trigger the installation of both upgrades and patches provided by the partner. After the initiated purchasing process via SAP Store, all these lifecycle activities are supported by the Landscape Portal. The Landscape Portal is part of the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and does not cause additional costs. 

 

Further information:

If you want to apply for the SAP PartnerEdge Build program, please use the online application form or refer to the SAP Partner Portal.

You can find more technical information about the Add-On Product

  • In the documentation of the Landscape Portal, applications for product lifecycle management
  • In the recording of the Devtoberfest Session: Building Partner Products on SAP BTP ABAP Environment

entry.title: VL02N - Delivery Output ->Header Update using RV_MESSAGE_INSERT
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying update NAST for VL02N after PGI to add Delivery Output->Header to add additional Output type using ABAP.

I have added the code in program MV50AFZ1 Userexit- USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE.

 DATA: ls_nast   TYPE nast,
        lt_nast   TYPE TABLE OF nast,
        lv_exists TYPE abap_bool.
  TABLES : nast.
  CLEAR lv_exists.
  SELECT COUNT(*)
    FROM nast
    WHERE kappl = 'V2'
      AND objky = likp-vbeln
    AND  kschl = 'ZGR1'   AND parvw = 'SP'
    AND parnr = likp-kunnr
    AND spras = 'ZH'
    .
   IF SY-SUBRC NE 0.
     LV_EXISTS = ABAP_FALSE.
   ENDIF.

    IF vbuk-wbstk ='C'.
      IF lv_exists = abap_false.
        CLEAR ls_nast.
        ls_nast-mandt = sy-mandt.
        ls_nast-kappl = 'V2'.
        ls_nast-objky = likp-vbeln.
        ls_nast-kschl = 'XYZ1'.
        ls_nast-parvw = 'SP'.
        ls_nast-parnr = likp-kunnr.
        ls_nast-spras = 'ZH'.
        ls_nast-nacha = '8'.
        ls_nast-vsztp = '4'.
        ls_nast-anzal = '1'.
        ls_nast-erdat = sy-datum.
        ls_nast-uhrvr = sy-uzeit.
        ls_nast-usnam = sy-uname.

        APPEND ls_nast TO lt_nast.
  CALL FUNCTION 'RV_MESSAGES_INSERT'
    TABLES
      tab_xnast = lt_nast.
  CALL FUNCTION 'RV_MESSAGES_UPDATE'
      EXPORTING
         msg_objky = ls_nast-objky.

   COMMIT WORK.
    ENDIF.
 ENDIF.

 XYZ1 is getting added in Delivery Output but existing output is also getting added again.
Can you please help me on this issue.

Thanks

entry.title: SAC Story - Date Dimension properties not available in scripting
entry.content:
In an SAC Story, which is using a Planning Model as the source, I am wanting to use the "setDimensionFilter" function on a property of the Date dimension.  However, the selected value is not being passed to the filter.  I have noticed that when I type "Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(" and then do a Ctrl + spacebar, only "Date" is listed in the available options - ie. the list does not include the likes of "Date.CALMONTH", etc.

This behaviour is only happeing at a particular client.

To replicate the issue I did the follwoing at 2 separate clients:

  • Created a new model - "Start with an empty model"
  • Added a measure "Value"
  • On the Date dimension, I changed the granularity to "Day"
  • Saved the model
  • From "Actions", created new story - Canvas
  • Added Table_1
  • For the page, added onInitialization script: Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(
  • Then Ctrl + spacebar

In the one client, the displayed list includes all the system generated properties of the Date dimension.  Eg "Date.CALMONTH", "Date.CALWEEK", etc. (1st screenshot below)

But in the other client system, I just see "Date".  Ie. no additional fields for the properties. (2nd screenshot below).

Both SAC environments are in the same data center - eu10.  And user auths are the same - both Admin rights.

Is there any reason why the Date properties wouldn't be available at the one client?

Rgds

Anton

 

Client #1 - Date properties listed and available for use

 

Client #2 - Date properties not listed and not available for use.

entry.title: Re: Hi Experts, I need to know what the exact number that...
entry.content:
Get KOBOG field value from KONA using your agreement number (KNUMA). Go to table T6B2 which maps KOBOG values to:

  • Condition table number
  • Field catalog
  • Application area

Use this mapping to identify the exact KOTE*** table (e.g., KOTE001, KOTE002) that stores the condition records for your rebate agreement.

entry.title: Re: VL02N - Delivery Output ->Header Update using RV_MESS...
entry.content: SAP Note 751000 introduces a more reliable user exit USEREXIT_SAVE_DOC_BEFORE_PREP, which may be better suited for output logic post-PGI.  Consider moving your logic there for better control.

entry.title: Re: Tax Compliance Tool
entry.content:
Hello Harish, 

As you have rightly indicated, the Run statutory reports (Part of the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solution) captures most of the steps of the process of VAT reporting. To highlight what's already available: 

  • Pre reporting activities to complete the preparatory steps before the actual legal output generation - Management of Tax items is an example. 
  • Timely and correct generation of legal reports for each country via a uniform UI and a harmonized set of steps
  • Embedded Analytics and Fiori preview to understand the legal return better
  • Fiori based manual adjustments of legal report output for last minute adjustments
  • Workflow approvals for internal auditing and checks and balances
  • Manual and electronic submission of report output to authorities
  • Post submission activities like Posting of Tax payables etc. 

Additionally, there is a solution called SAP Tax Compliance (S/4HANA O/P add on) which can be used to run data sanity checks (standard and custom rules) on the reporting data. Tax Compliance activity can be configured to be used as a pre-reporting activity in the Run statutory reports app. Please reach out via your Account Executive or respond here if you're looking for specific capabilities that are not covered within the purview of DRC and Run Statutory reports app. 

Regards, 
Anoochan

entry.title: Re: External Resource for Trial Account in SAP BAS
entry.content:
Hi @HarleyLlevado_SAPDev 

In the SAP Business Application Studio exercise, the Business Partner (A2X) service shows “No sandbox environment” because this API doesn’t have a public test endpoint. It requires an active S/4HANA Cloud system with the service enabled and exposed via Communication Arrangement.

This is how I suggest you proceed:

If you have access to an S/4HANA Cloud, either Public or Private Edition tenant, ensure to set up a Communication Scenario an example would be SAP_COM_0008, with the aim to expose the Business Partner API, then connect BAS to that destination.

If you do not have such access, use a service that does have a sandbox in the SAP API Business Hub for example Product Master to read or Sales Order to Simulate. By doing that you can complete the exercise steps without a backend system.

For your learning demo purposes, you also have the option to mock the API in Business Application Studio by generating a local OData or REST mock server with the API schema.

The summary on this is, this step cannot run “as is” in a public sandbox; you either need a real S/4HANA backend or swap in a different API that offers a sandbox endpoint.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Do not show blogs in bundle data and consolidation mo...
entry.content: As you are using OP, it is possible to schedule all those tasks via background job SM36. If you don't know the program name for each task, run them in monitor via background mode and check job log via SM37. Please bear the recommended approach is to either run the bundle via monitor or schedule them via Fiori app consolidation job scheduler.

entry.title: Re: VL02N - Delivery Output ->Header Update using RV_MESS...
entry.content:
Hello @devyani13 

I would suggest not to use any user-exit enhancements here and use standard output determination in outbound deliveries instead. The output type can be assigned to an output determination procedure with the requirement 1 "Delivery GI posted". The requirement checks if GI is already posted for the outbound delivery. Thus, the output type will be determined only during GI posting. I guess that is what you want to implement. 

The output will work similarly to standard SPED output - see https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/output-type-sped-trigger-inbound-delivery-after-pgi-for-inter-company-sto-s/ba-p/13505818 

I think it is a cleaner way to implement a new output determination during outbound delivery GI as compared to a user-exit enhancement and direct NAST updates.

Additionally consider the note 415716 - User exits in delivery processing for detailed documentation on enhancements in delivery processing. 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Crystal runtime not respecting Isolate Report/Page se...
entry.content:
Hi Simi,

R&D found my problem, you have specifically set the Isolation option, I didn't have it set for Group level:

        //RasCSVExpOpts.GroupSectionsOption = CrCSVExportSectionsOptionEnum.crCSVExportSectionsOptionExport;
        //RasCSVExpOpts.ReportSectionsOption = CrCSVExportSectionsOptionEnum.crCSVExportSectionsOptionExportIsolated;

Should be:

RasCSVExpOpts.GroupSectionsOption = CrCSVExportSectionsOptionEnum.crCSVExportSectionsOptionExportIsolated;
RasCSVExpOpts.ReportSectionsOption = CrCSVExportSectionsOptionEnum.crCSVExportSectionsOptionExportIsolated;

Same with your code, you need to specifically set group isolation:

CR .NET code piece:
            CrystalDecisions.Shared.CharacterSeparatedValuesFormatOptions csvExpOpts = new CrystalDecisions.Shared.CharacterSeparatedValuesFormatOptions();
            CrystalDecisions.Shared.ExportOptions exportOpts = new CrystalDecisions.Shared.ExportOptions();
            CrystalDecisions.Shared.DiskFileDestinationOptions diskOpts = CrystalDecisions.Shared.ExportOptions.CreateDiskFileDestinationOptions();
            diskOpts.DiskFileName = outputFileName;

            csvExpOpts.ExportMode = CrystalDecisions.Shared.CsvExportMode.Standard;
            csvExpOpts.GroupSectionsOption = CrystalDecisions.Shared.CsvExportSectionsOption.ExportIsolated;
            csvExpOpts.ReportSectionsOption = CrystalDecisions.Shared.CsvExportSectionsOption.ExportIsolated;
            exportOpts.DestinationOptions = diskOpts;
            exportOpts.ExportDestinationType = CrystalDecisions.Shared.ExportDestinationType.DiskFile;
            exportOpts.ExportFormatType = CrystalDecisions.Shared.ExportFormatType.CharacterSeparatedValues;
            exportOpts.ExportFormatOptions = csvExpOpts;
            try
            {
                rd.Export(exportOpts);
            }
            catch (Exception e)
            {
                throw (e);
            }

Not sure why it used to work for you, possibly because Product added the saved export options...

See that works for you, it worked for me

Don

entry.title: Re: SAP ERP, Private Edition, Transition Option: What Does it Mean for You as a Healthcare Customer?
entry.content:
Good points, Chandrakant.

a key difference to the migration option to SAP ERP Private Edition is that it involves migrating a proven, existing IS-H/ECC system to an SAP-managed Private Edition on HANA. This allows it to continue running for up to three additional years (2031–2033) with full support, including legal changes and patches, while the migration to S/4HANA is planned.

We might call it technical safeguarding, but in my opinion, it's more than that; it's more of a "strategic enabler." It offers additional time flexibility under current conditions and enables modernization at own pace. To support our customers here, we got only positive feedback on the architecture service depicted below. Explicitly and in the respective customer context, it addresses most of your points and addresses corresponding questions and concerns.

Furthermore, my clear recommendation regarding modernization/transformation is to think in the direction of a modular, interoperable platform architecture. In contrast to monolithic landscapes, platforms form open, interoperable ecosystems that, thanks to their modular architecture, evolve faster, scale more easily, and are more future proof in the long term than monolithic IT landscapes.

Brief recap: "Digital platforms will redefine healthcare."

Happy reading!

VG

entry.title: Administering Applications including last used date in Customer Data Cloud
entry.content:
We use Customer Data Cloud and in order to adhere to our security standards need to ensure that we are up to date with who has access to our data.

Within the Administrator page there is a list of "Applications" which includes the Groups they are assigned to but not a lot else.

It would be useful for me if I could see the last time an Application or it"s credentials had been used.  

I can do this through the audit but it is rather time consuming and is only as accurate as the length of time that we hold audits for.

I can and have used Postman and the APIs admin.getGroups and admin.getGroupUsers but the responses do not include that detail.

Is there anywhere or anyway I can retrieve this information?  This is needed so that we can be seen to audit access to Personal Information which is a legal and business compliance issue.

entry.title: Re: Situation Handling: Error during related app Navigation
entry.content:
Hello @KAILASH1 

Thank you for the detailed screenshots. Your steps for configuring the situation object, scenario, template, and type appear correct, but navigation problems are typically caused by one of these factors:

Semantic Object/Action mismatch: -Ensure they match exactly what’s defined for Monitor Purchase Order Down Payments in the Fiori Apps Library and include all mandatory parameters.

Missing business role/catalogue: Users must have access to the catalogue for the target app.

Event not bound: For event-based triggers, confirm the event is active and linked to the situation scenario; otherwise, only batch triggers work.

Test the link via Manage Semantic Objects and check the situation log to verify parameters.

Check this SAP Video Reference: SAP Help – Situation Handling (Public Cloud)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Patient Management achieves another milestone in Healthcare digitalization
entry.content:
Great news from SAP! We've reached another significant milestone in the digitalization of healthcare. I'm happy to announce that SAP Patient Management (IS-H) has once again received confirmation for FHIR interfaces compliant with ISiK specifications. This latest certification for ISiK Level 3 encompasses two modules: the Base Module and the Appointment Scheduling Module.

Some background: To promote data exchange in German hospitals healthcare, the German National Agency for digital medicine Gematik was mandated to develop binding standards. These standards are based on the HL7 FHIR® standard and are described in the ISiK (Information Systems in Hospitals) specification.

ISiK standards are mandatory. They are published in releases/levels (German "Stufe") and must be implemented within a transition period of 24 months after publishing. IS-H received the first confirmation for ISiK compliance for ISiK Level 1 in December 2021.

While ISiK is specific to Germany, it represents a broader global trend towards standardization in healthcare data exchange. Many countries are developing similar initiatives based on the HL7 FHIR standard to improve interoperability in their healthcare systems.

How did we achieve this certification?

  • SAP Patient Management offers a FHIR interface and framework since 2020, which we continuously enhance – at no additional cost as part of our maintenance services. This framework allows for the extension and customization of delivered generic profiles.
  • Our partner KMSEC developed the FIRENIO add-on based on this framework. This add-on implements the ISiK specification and was used again to achieve the ISiK certification. Thanks once more to Kai Mindermann for the excellent collaboration!

While ISiK is a German standard, the underlying FHIR standard is applicable globally. SAP's commitment to FHIR ensures that our solutions can adapt to various national and regional healthcare interoperability standards worldwide.

We welcome efforts like those of Gematik in Germany and similar initiatives in other countries to improve interoperability in healthcare. At the same time, we recognize the need for these open interfaces to be implementable in hospital settings at reasonable costs. Only through widespread adoption can we achieve sustainable improvements in patient care across different healthcare systems.

Are you interested in other FHIR-based solutions from SAP? Then I recommend exploring SAP Health Data Services for FHIR (Link) or reading my last blog. This solution can help healthcare organizations worldwide leverage FHIR standards for improved data exchange and interoperability.

As healthcare continues to digitalize globally, SAP remains committed to providing cutting-edge solutions that meet both local regulatory requirements and international standards. We're excited to support our partners and customers in their journey towards more connected, efficient, and patient-centric healthcare systems.

entry.title: Women Connect | Brasil | Oportunidade para Estudantes
entry.content:
É com grande entusiasmo que apresentamos uma nova oportunidade especial para seus estudantes: vem aí mais uma edição do nosso evento que celebra conexão, inclusão e inovação.

A Business Women’s Network, em parceria com o programa Early Talents, convida universitários, jovens talentos e profissionais apaixonados por tecnologia a se conectar com o ecossistema SAP e com novas possibilidades de carreira.

Nesta edição, vamos explorar como inovação, transformação tecnológica, sustentabilidade, equidade e inclusão impulsionam trajetórias com propósito.

Com participações especiais de:

  • Marilia Lins – Coordenadora de Diversidade & Inclusão na Natura

  • Marcele Andrade – Strategic Leader e membro do Comitê de Sustentabilidade da SAP

  • Cecilia Vernabel – Strategic Deal Engagement Officer na área de SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS)

Mediação: Henrique Orpheu e Leila Gazola, da SAP.

Prepare-se para se inspirar, fazer networking e trocar experiências em um espaço que valoriza o impacto positivo.

Data: 2 de setembro, às 14h
Formato: Híbrido – participe presencialmente em São Paulo ou online.

Inscreva-se e venha fazer parte dessa rede que está moldando o futuro.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 1: Introduction to Data Products
entry.content: @Patric_E On technical level data products are same - replication on HDLF, discovery using ORD protocol. this applies to all the types of SAP BDC products ( SAP managed, customer managed or partner managed). however when we say SAP-managed HDLF (FOS layer) is used for the replication and managed by SAP. While for customer HDLF(Datasphere object store) is used for the replication and managed by customer.

entry.title: Integration Advisor – Download MAG Simulation Result as EDI Payload
entry.content:
In this blog post I would like to share with you a small new feature we have delivered: When downloading the result of a Mapping Guideline (MAG) simulation you have now the additional option to get the payload in EDI format. 

Recap: Using Source EDI Payloads in Integration Advisor

Last year we added direct support for EDI payloads in the Integration Advisor capability of SAP Integration Suite.

In Integration Advisor, there are multiple places where you can make use of your existing payload data:

  • Create a Message Implementation Guideline (MIG) based on a payload
  • Simulate a Message Implementation Guideline (MIG)
  • Simulate a Mapping Guideline (MAG)

If your source payload is a text-based (flat-file) EDI message (from B2B Standards like ASC X12, UN/EDIFACT and its subsets, Odette or TRADACOMS), you can use the EDI payload directly as input for these features.

More details can be found in this previous blog post: Link

Download MAG Simulation Result as EDI Payload

So far, EDI support has been limited to source payloads. From the SAP Customer Influence program we have learned that a similar feature would also be interesting for the target payload (see here for more details: Link). 

After executing a MAG Simulation, you have the option to download the target payload which was the result of the simulation. For this you can use the Download button - refer above screenshot for MAG Simulation. If your Target MIG represents an EDI message, then you have now the additional option to download the result in EDI format. See screenshot below for the downloaded file of our example. 

Conclusion

This blog post explains our new feature to download a MAG simulation result as an EDI payload. This will help you to work even more efficiently with Integration Advisor if you want to compare the simulation result with an existing expected target EDI payload. 

(Note: This feature will become available with the August update of SAP Integration Suite which is currently rolled out to all data centers.)

Further reading

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/integration-advisor-direct-support-of-edi-payloads/ba-p/13779418 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/integration-advisor-overview-of-components-for-... 

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/simulating-mapping-guideline

entry.title: Re: Issue with Form Language in Billing Document Output I...
entry.content:
Hello @Ayman101,

I see that on your parameter 'OUTPUT', the first line has the value =" ". This condition compares if the value of the field 'OUTPUT' is equal to a space. This would result in bellow cases:

  • OUTPUT =  "" (blank) > false.
  • OUTPUT = " " > true.
  • OUTPUT = "test" > false
  • OUTPUT = true > false
  • OUTPUT = 1 > false.

Make sure this filter is set up correctly because it might be giving you the wrong determinations. If you don't want to filter by anything on the 'OUTPUT' field, just clear the value instead of setting a space. Since this line might not determine the language if the condition is false, the system can get the language from other place, such as the business partner language,

Kind regards,
Luiza

entry.title: Time Frame for Breaks in Time Tracking
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a customer requirement regarding breaks, which is as follows:

If employees clock out and back in for their lunch break between 12:00 and 14:00, the time will be counted as a break. Breaks taken outside this time window should not be considered.

Is it possible in the system to define a break window in which breaks are counted, and outside of which they are not?

Example:

  • Employee takes a break from 11:30 to 12:00 → break is not counted

  • Employee takes a break from 12:30 to 13:00 → break is counted

I would greatly appreciate any tips you might have!

Best regards,
Simon

entry.title: Managing Themes Across SAP Environments
entry.content:
In this blog post, I’ll share best practices for managing themes created with the UI theme designer across multiple SAP environments. This guide is especially relevant if you run applications on more than one SAP platform.

Theming Scenarios Covered

  • SAP Build Work Zone Theming:
    Integrating applications into SAP Build Work Zone and leveraging its theming capabilities.
  • Local Theming:
    Using the UI theme designer installed in a specific environment. Themes are distributed via export, import, and transport mechanisms.
  • Remote Theming:
    Using the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, and accessing theme CSS remotely.

UI Theme Designer Availability

  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment:
    Always provides the latest version of the UI theme designer.
  • SAP BTP, Neo environment:
    In maintenance mode (version 1.75). Receives patches and bug fixes, but not new features.
  • SAP S/4HANA:
    The available UI theme designer version depends on your S/4HANA release. See SAP Note 1852401 for details.
  • SAP NetWeaver Portal:
    In maintenance mode (up to version 1.60). Included in UISAPUI5JAVASCA. See SAP Note 3414472 for more information.
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud:
    Use the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment. For logo customization only, use SAP Fiori Launchpad settings.

Key Differences

  • ABAP Platform & SAP NetWeaver Portal:
    Custom theme CSS is stored in the platform. After updating UI technology or theming content, you must rebuild and republish themes for compatibility.
  • SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry & Neo):
    The theming service compiles theme CSS on demand for the requested UI technology version. No manual action is needed when UI technology versions are updated.

For more details on theming capabilities in specific environments, see SAP Note 1852400.

Let’s now explore each scenario in detail.

SAP Build Work Zone Theming

SAP Build Work Zone allows you to integrate applications from various environments into a single site. By applying a theme to your SAP Build Work Zone site, all integrated applications can inherit this theme, ensuring a consistent user experience across platforms—without the need to implement the theme separately in each environment.

An additional benefit is that the UI theme designer in SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment compiles the CSS for the specific UI technology version on demand, so you don’t need to manage theming for different UI technology versions manually.

Example: A SAP Build Work Zone site integrating an S/4HANA on-premise application.

If your theme is based on a modern SAP theme (such as Horizon) that isn’t supported by the UI technology version in your integrated system, you can define a fallback theme. To do this, open the UI theme designer, edit your main theme, go to the theme menu, select “Properties”, and add a fallback theme in the properties dialog.

For more information, see:

  • SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, Theming and Branding
  • SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, Theming and Branding
  • S/4HANA: Running a Custom Theme via a URL Parameter
  • SAP BTP: Running a Custom Theme via a URL Parameter
  • SAPUI5 SAP Theme Support
  • Unified Rendering SAP Theme Support

Local Theming

If your system includes the UI theme designer, you can manage themes locally and assign them to applications within that system. The theme format is consistent across different versions of the UI theme designer, allowing you to export and import themes as needed. Note that in some environments, you must compile a theme before it can be assigned to applications.

Many platforms also support transporting themes within the same environment. For example, you can transport a theme from a development system to a test system, and then to a production system. The following platforms support theme transport:

  • S/4HANA on-premise
  • SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment

A key challenge with this approach is maintaining version consistency across all systems. It’s recommended to designate one main system for editing your theme and distribute it from there—ideally, the system with the latest version of the UI theme designer. If you use SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, it’s best to manage and edit your themes there to take advantage of the newest features.

For more information, see:

  • S4HANA: Transporting Themes Between Systems
  • SAP BTP: Transporting Themes Between Systems
  • Exporting Themes
  • Importing Themes

Remote Theming

You can integrate the UI theme designer from SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, with your S/4HANA Cloud systems to theme the SAP Fiori Launchpad and applications.

To do this, configure the remote connection using communication arrangement SAP_COM_0623. This setup allows you to create themes in SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry environment, and apply them directly in your S/4HANA Cloud system.

For more information, see:

  • Integrating UI Theme Designer

Conclusion

The SAP Build Work Zone theming scenario requires the least effort, as you maintain a central theme that is automatically applied across all integrated systems. However, local and remote theming are also viable options. If you choose these approaches, it’s important to decide on a primary system for theme management and plan your theme distribution strategy to ensure consistency across environments.

We encourage you to ask questions and share your experiences with managing themes across SAP environments in the comments section. We look forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: Error M7053 - Posting period in goods movement
entry.content:
If you find the error M7053 as shown in the image below:

You can try to follow the steps:

First of all, it’s important to mention that I tried to post goods in 08/2025, but my posting period ended in 06/2025. Therefore, I first need to check and close the period for 07/2025, and only then will I be able to verify the latest period — 08/2025.

1. Go to the app "Close Periods":

2. Fill the company code, the period - with the month (e.g. 07/2025) following the last posting period (e.g 06/2025) - and fiscal year boxe. Then select "Check and close periods": 

If you fill the period with the current month, like 08/2025 in this example, you are going to see the log below: 

3. So, after you close the period for 07/2025, you can repeat the same steps for the current month. After that, you should be able to perform postings goods in the current period.

entry.title: Re: cannot access public cloud
entry.content:
Hello @OmarEmbaby 

The error seems to be related to Single Sign‑On (SSO) via SAML. Since it works on other laptops but not on yours, it is likely caused by something in your local environment rather than a pure system issue.

To resolve that error, I suggest you do the following:

  • First, clear your browser cache or cookies for your SAP domains.
  • Then, consider trying incognito or private mode or a different browser.
  • Next step will be to Verify your laptop’s date and time is correct.
  • Thereafter, temporarily disable browser extensions.
  • Please also check if VPN, proxy, or firewall is blocking SAML requests.
  • Finally, you should fully log out from all SAP sessions before retrying.

If these steps do not resolve it, involve your organization's IT to review your laptop’s security or network policies.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice – Authorization...
entry.content:
This issue could be due to

  • missing role assignments or
  • incorrect Agent determination or
  • missing configuration in My Inbox or task-specific UI settings.

So what you can do is check Agent Determination in Workflow Step. Verify user authorization for role with workflow task processing. If I am correct, the authorization object is B_BUPA_RLT.  Confirm with your Security team.

Check this SAP Help on Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices
Also check this SAP Help on How to Configure Flexible Workflow

entry.title: Is there a S/4HANA cloud test/demo/development system for partners including sample data like IDES?
entry.content:
Hi folks,

This might be a noob question, but I cannot find an answer to it on the web and reaching out to SAP about only gives me e-mail after e-mail of links that I already found myself and that do not answer my question. So, maybe the community can help!?

Here is what I am looking for: we want to get access to a cloud based SAP ERP environment that allows us to develop a ABAP report and create a transport for it (SE38, SE93, SE10, SE80, STMS, ...). To be able to develop and test the program, the system needs to be prefilled with a "meaningful" amount of data in the MM and PP area, such as material master data, business partner master data, BOMs, sales orders, invoices, purchase orders, and so on. I do not have time to create all that data in a substantial amount myself. And we do not have a SAP system for migration or a data set that we could import. I formerly had access to an on-prem R/3 installation with the IDES (internet demonstration and evaluation system) data. Basically, we are looking for something similar, but a cloud-based offering with development rights. 2 or 3 named users would be sufficient. 

So the question is, is there such an offer by SAP and if so, where can I find it. Ohh, btw, we are SAP partners, so this can also be a partner offering.

Thank you
Thomas

entry.title: Re: Bex filter info Object search by text fails
entry.content:
Hi @solman_solman2 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Please note that during testing of the BW query using the InfoObject, you have the option to filter successfully by key but not by text. Even when you check the hierarchy text table it shows the same behaviour.

Based on the details you provided, I suggest you consider the following:

  1. You should check and ensure InfoObject text assignments in RSA1 --> InfoObject --> Text tab.
  2. Make sure you verify text records exist in the correct table and are loaded.
  3. Ensure your query includes required text joins or necessary attributes.
  4. Also confirm whether filtering is applied on hierarchy text or characteristic text.
  5. Test the search in another front‑end tool. An example is Analysis for Office.

These checks should help you pinpoint why your text‑based filtering fails while the key‑based filtering works.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Project Kernseife - improving the measurement of Clean Core in ABAP
entry.content:
Hi Rishi

very good question and the answer is definitily: yes, Kernseife is still relevant.
If you read the new whitepaper carefully, you might have even seen that Kernseife is referenced there. 😉
We are working on an official Release of the Kernseife BTP App which will include a reporting on the Levels.
Our Ratings were already pretty "aligned" (Released => A, Recommended => B, Internal => C and Avoid => D).
With a custom classification in Kernseife you could even go further and classify all BADI_DEFss, Interfaces and Enhancement Spots of BADIs marked as "SAP Internal" as "Avoid" and make them D, to be sure that no "SAP Internal" BADI is used.
Just as an example.

Regards,
Daniel

entry.title: How to Transport SAC Models and Import Jobs between Tenants without including the Source Connection
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are performing a migration between SAC tenants.
One tenant is QAS, where the data models are connected to an S4 QAS system, and the other tenant is PRD, where the migrated data models should connect to the S4 PRD system.

The client’s requirement is that in SAC QAS there should only be the S4 QAS connection, and in SAC PRD there should only be the S4 PRD connection.

At the moment, the only working method we found to migrate the models, while keeping their Import Jobs and transformations, is:

  1. Export the model with the source connection from QAS.

  2. Import it into PRD.

  3. Replace the data source in the Import Job with the PRD connection.

  4. Delete the QAS connection imported into PRD.

We are looking for a more efficient approach.

Is there a way to:

  • Redirect the connection during export/import, or

  • Transport Import Jobs (including transformations) without having to export the QAS connection?

Regarding this second point, we found old notes mentioning an object called “Wrangler” that would migrate transformations, but we cannot find this object anymore.
Reference: SAP Community discussion on "Wrangler" object. 

Any guidance or updated best practice would be appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: How to Set Up Automatic Login in SAP
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I need help with the following:

I want to be able to log in automatically from the SAP deployment, making it easier for the user so that they only need to access the deployment without having to manually enter their credentials (email and password) every time.

I am looking for a script or method that captures those credentials and performs the login automatically.

Has anyone managed to achieve this idea or can help me with it?

entry.title: Re: Tag AGROPECUARIO referente NT 2024.003
entry.content: Em dois clientes a nota 3527792 não está aplicando corretamente. Nela mesmo tem uma OBS: Atenção: se você ainda não tiver implementado esta nota, implemente a nota 3642755. Se 3527792 tiver sido implementado com erro, a nota 3642755 corrige este problema. Mas a 3642755 ainda não foi lançada.

entry.title: Re: Unable to create new purchase order Header text
entry.content:
Hi,

You cannot add new standard text types directly in the configuration screen using the SSCUI. 

The system is designed to allow only SAP-delivered text types. 

You may monitor the idea submitted in the customer influence portal for more updates https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/310999

Best regards,

Krithika

entry.title: Re: Forgot to Punch Again! - How to Limit Attendance Regularization in SuccessFactors Time Tracking
entry.content: @Rohit-Mahajan , thank you for your quick response and explanation. I understand now. SuccessFactors offer a standard way how to update missed punches; i.e. in timesheet; and this is context of my organization at the moment - planning to use mobile UI instead of clock in clock out terminals. Therefore I was a bit confused with your use case. All clear now. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Creating Purchase Order Header text ID's in SAP S4 HA...
entry.content:
Hi,

You cannot add new standard text types directly in the configuration screen using the SSCUI. 

The system is designed to allow only SAP-delivered text types. There are no BAdI's or CDS views which caters this requirement.

You may monitor the idea submitted in the customer influence portal for more updates https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/310999

Best regards,

Krithika

entry.title: The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to update a Custom Field of a Billing Document (aka customer invoice) on Public Cloud from SAP Integration Suite.

SAP provides 2 different APIs for Billing Documents:
ODATA V2: https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/overview
ODATA V4: https://api.sap.com/api/sap-s4-CE_BILLINGDOCUMENT_0001-v1/overview

Unlike for Sales Orders, where the V2 can be used for PATCH calls, for Billing Documents, only the ODATA V4 has the option to PATCH the object.
However, when I try using the ODATA V4 adaptor in Integration Suite, it gives the following error:
"The Data Service Request is required to be conditional. Try using the "If-Match" headernull [HTTP/1.1 428 Precondition Required]."

My steps are: 

Request Reply: ODATA V4 - a simple GET call to retrieve the E-tag in the header for the given Billing Docuement
Content Modifier: Create Body and Add "If-Match" on the Header from the E-tag
Request Reply: ODATA V4 - PATCH to update a custom field

But the PATCH call fails:

I have also tried to set the "If-Match" to *, but I get the same error.

The same steps for the Sales Order ODATA V2 is working, but I the Billing Document ODATA V4 gives me the above error.

Am I missing something, or am I doing something wrong?
Or is the ODATA V4 adaptor broken?

Any tips would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Notifications from SAP Build Apps to Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi,

I am trying to send notifications from my SAP Build Apps application to my Work Zone site, but I can't understand how to do it right. I am using SAP Mobile Start app, that is why I want to have in-app notifications on my Work Zone site under the bell icon. I generated credentials for my Work Zone ANS, but can't understand what I need to do next. I was trying to create a destination and send the notification using action from Marketplace called "HTTP destination request". Important thing that I am using SAP Build Apps (no-code) which is under Front End section. 
That is how it looks:

But when I am trying to send, I got such an error:{"status":401,"message":"Unauthorized","timestamp":1755098300,"path":"/v1/alerts","error":"Unauthorized"}
Of course, because there is no any API-key or something else. 

I was trying to use ANS notifications, because that is the only thing that I could enable on my Work Zone settings, but maybe there is something else? 

I would really appreciate any instructions about that or any other workarounds.

Best regards,
Vladyslav

entry.title: Re: How to build custom extensions using BTP in SuccessFa...
entry.content:
Hi Karthik,

You can use SAP Business Application Studio to build a CAPM application using Node JS/Java as back end.

Once the application is built and deployed in SAP BTP, you can call the endpoint in the homepage tile of SuccessFactors to redirect to your application.

 

BR,

Raihan

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 2: Extend SAP S/4HANA Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@SreekanthSurampally that is true as delta share capability is still on the roadmap for Datasphere, its coming soon. As soon as DP is activated or IA is installed data is moved into FOS and Datasphere ingestion space. When you install DP it is basically share from Datasphere ingestion space to other customer-managed Datasphere space. Refer to help document.  

Are you talking about SAP Databricks data product? because if you plan to install that then you get two options 1. Remote table (Delta share) 2. Replication flow.

Hope this helps - Jeet and Happy learning!

entry.title: Re: Call Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application us...
entry.content: The "SF user id" is the id by which users are identified inside successfactors. Like 'sfadmin' for an admin user. It could be email addresses or firstlastname usernames, ... Whatever it is, that value has to be available somewhere in the IAS profile in a chosen field, and this field (e.g. "login name" or "custom attribute 1") has to be added into the IAS Assertion Attributes to be included in the JWT. Then in the Destination set userIdSource to the path in the token where to find it. See also: https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/configure-user-attributes-sent-to-application

entry.title: Re: Investment indicator
entry.content:
Hello @jantoniomoyano3 

For SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the Investment Indicator is a country-specific field primarily relevant in localisations such as France, where it triggers specific tax or reporting procedures for capital investment transactions.

In Spain, this indicator is inactive and does not affect standard financial processing or legal reporting. Therefore, selecting it in the Create Incoming Invoices (FB60) app results in no change in posting behaviour or subsequent processes.

You can confirm this by reviewing the Spanish localisation scope in the SAP Help Portal and Feature Scope Description. There is no mapping or specific logic associated with the investment indicator for Spain. It will merely stay an unused field unless it is explicitly repurposed in a custom extension.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 🔴 IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)
entry.content:
Developers often face challenges understanding the IT system landscape: What systems exist, what services do they offer, and how can they be integrated? Open Resource Discovery (ORD) addresses this issue by providing an open-source standard for decentralized system descriptions. ORD details available APIs, events, data products, and AI resources, along with their contracts and documentation.

In this talk, we will explain what ORD is, the problems it solves, and why we created it. We will also discuss how SAP leverages ORD to publish a static catalog of offerings, enable real-time landscape introspection, and support products like SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Business Data Cloud, and SAP Build.

Additionally, we will present how we have built an ecosystem to simplify ORD adoption, helping developers identify issues earlier and improve the quality of metadata and documentation over time for both SAP and our customers.

Finally, we will share our current thinking on how ORD can benefit the AI ecosystem.
